intro: Eugenia earhartii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture with a glossy surface. Eugenia earhartii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
